text: "Do It!" is a Japanese-language song recorded by Japanese singer songwriter Mai Kuraki, taken from her twelfth studio album Kimi Omou: Shunkashūtō (2018).. It was released on March 9, 2018 by Northern Music and served as the official fight song for 2018 Nagoya Women's Marathon, which was held on March 11, 2018. It was written by Kuraki and her long-time collaborator, Akihito Tokunaga. ==Background== On February 27, 2018, Kuraki announced that she would release three singles "We Are Happy Women", "Do It!" and "Light Up My Life" respectively on three consecutive weeks. On March 1, 2018, "Do It!" was unexpectedly released to some radio stations like and with no announcements. These radio stations are based in Nagoya, where 2018 Nagoya Women's Marathon would take place. On the day of the release of "We Are Happy Women", the official trailer for these three songs were uploaded on YouTube. == Live performance == On March 11, 2018, Kuraki performed "Do It!" at the 2018 Nagoya Women's Marathon, which was held in Nagoya Dome. ==Track listing== ==Charts== ===Daily charts=== {| class="wikitable sortable plainrowheaders" |- ! scope="col" | Chart (2018) ! scope="col" | Peak position |- |Japan RecoChoku () |style="text-align:center;"|6 |- |Japan mora (mora Daily Singles) |style="text-align:center;"|4 |- |Japan Dwango (Dwango Daily Singles) |style="text-align:center;"|38 |- |Japan music.jp () |style="text-align:center;"|15 |- |} ===Weekly charts=== {| class="wikitable sortable plainrowheaders" |- ! scope="col" | Chart (2018) ! scope="col" | Peak position |- |Japan (Billboard Japan Top Download Songs) |style="text- align:center;"|74 |- |Japan RecoChoku () |style="text-align:center;"|24 |- |Japan mora (mora Weekly Singles) |style="text-align:center;"|14 |- |Japan music.jp () |style="text-align:center;"|34 |- |} ==Release history== {| class="wikitable sortable plainrowheaders" |- ! scope="col"| Region ! scope="col"| Date ! scope="col"| Format ! scope="col"| Label ! scope="col"| Ref. |- |Japan |March 9, 2018 | Digital download |Northern Music | |- |} ==References== Category:2018 singles Category:Mai Kuraki songs Category:Songs written by Mai Kuraki Category:2018 songs Category:Songs with music by Akihito Tokunaga Category:Song recordings produced by Daiko Nagato
